task.summary: Default task
added methods for reading from and writing to SBinit.txt to retrieve a listing of json files created by Tasks and the userProfile.
minor commenting fixes

Merge branch 'Phase1_MShearer' of https://github.com/skillblazer/SkillBlazerDev into Jason_funWithFiles_09APR
# Conflicts: # SkillBlazerDev/src/llamasoft/skillblazer/UserProfile.java MERGED CHANGES - KEPT Mark's changes in UserProfile.java over my original member fields DID NOT Merge TwitterIntegration (YET)

Merge branch 'Phase1_MShearer' of https://github.com/skillblazer/SkillBlazerDev into Jason_funWithFiles_09APR
# Conflicts: # SkillBlazerDev/src/llamasoft/skillblazer/UserProfile.java MERGED CHANGES - KEPT Mark's changes in UserProfile.java over my original member fields DID NOT Merge TwitterIntegration (YET)
SkillBlazerInitializer and its methods are working as intended. SkillBlazer.java has a driver which validates the ability to add directory/SBinit.txt and read/write filenames to SBinit.txt
added troubleshooting steps to the IOException error output in SkillBlazerInitializer.java
better error handling with useful output in SKillBlazerInitializer.java

Added fully qualified constructors for all subclasses so that Tasks can be instantiated from the contents of a file on disk. boolean isCompleted is now a member of Task and all subclasses to simplify instantiating from Disk redesigning JSONLoader.java so that parsing and instantiating Task objects is less convoluted

Completed the parseAndCreateTask(JSONObject jsonObject, ArrayList<Task> taskArrayList). This method follows the fully defined constructors I added to Task, DailyTask, WeeklyTask, CustomTask and CumulativeTask earlier
added method private UserProfile parseAndReturnUserProfile(JSONObject jsonObject() to instantiate the UserProfile object using the contents of a userProfile.json file saved to disk
added method private UserProfile parseAndReturnUserProfile(JSONObject jsonObject() to instantiate the UserProfile object using the contents of a userProfile.json file saved to disk
added method private UserProfile parseAndReturnUserProfile(JSONObject jsonObject() to instantiate the UserProfile object using the contents of a userProfile.json file saved to disk
removed test method prior to commit for Phase 1 merges
removed test method prior to commit for Phase 1 merges
removed test method prior to commit for Phase 1 merges

Merge branches 'Jason_Phase1_MergeAttempt' and 'Phase1_MShearer' of https://github.com/skillblazer/SkillBlazerDev into Jason_Phase1_MergeAttempt
# Conflicts: # SkillBlazerDev/src/llamasoft/skillblazer/TwitterIntegration.java

Merge branches 'Interface_RDavis_20180408' and 'Jason_Phase1_MergeAttempt' of https://github.com/skillblazer/SkillBlazerDev into Jason_Phase1_MergeAttempt
# Conflicts: # SkillBlazerDev/src/llamasoft/skillblazer/SkillBlazer.java
added citation for method: CalendarCalculator.isLeapYear()
added citation for method: CalendarCalculator.isLeapYear()
Pulled from Rebecca's PhaseII branch and am now creating my PhaseII branch
Major refactor of JSONLoader.java -> needs testing but its in a lot better shape!
Major refactor of JSONLoader.java -> needs testing but its in a lot better shape!
Developing tests and double checking execution flow in JSONLoader
Removed primitive (int) and (long) casts throughout JSONLoader.java -> ArrayList<Task> now returning arrays to test main() method! UserProfile object now being instantiated correctly!

Finished testing the CumulativeTask.java, CustomTask.java, DailyTask.java, WeeklyTask.java and UserProfile.java classes (instantiating them from json objects stored to disk). Removed test code, and left the necessary object instantiations in SkillBlazer.java and SkillBlazer.main()

fixed casts to values that should be (long) in JSONWriter.java removed unneeded class fields - corrected return statement in Task.getTaskId() so it returns a useful value - removed commented out code from SkillBlazer.java - removed unused fields in JSONLoader.java
one last obsolete comment removal in loadFromJSON() in JSONLoader.java

Laid out basic components of JSONWriter.java -> added methods addFileToInit, writeUserProfileToDisk(), writeCumulativeTaskToDisk(), writeCustomTaskToDisk(), writeDailyTaskToDisk(), writeWeeklyTaskToDisk() and saveUser() so that saving Tasks and the UserProfile can be performed as single operations. These methods will be called by convertArrayListToJSONArray() once completed. In JSONLoader.java I made skillBlazerInit and userProfile package-protected members (no longer private) to ease use in other classes. Also made skillBlazerInit STATIC for the same reason.
Initial version of writeUserProfileToDisk() created
Initial version of JSONWriter.java is completed and ready for testing/verification.

created method saveAllFilesToDisk() in JSONWriter.java -> compiles, but the casts need to be replaced with Generics or the writeTaskToJSON() methods should be moved to their appropriate Task subclasses!
Moved the individual sub-Task writeTaskToJSON() methods to their respective classes as @Override methods of Task.writeTaskToJSON() SHUTDOWN ROUTINE NOW COMPILES WITHOUT DISGUSTING NASTY CASTS!
removed unneeded imports from JSONWriter.java
added JSONWriter instantiation in SkillBlazer.java (class member field) and updated comments in JSONWriter.java
added method convertInt(Long value) to JSONLoader.java to significantly reduce assignment statements in the parsing methods

fixed maddening bug in SkillBlazerInitializer.java method getFileList() that was not returning file names from SBinit.txt correctly, thus causing items to never get parsed. Now the bug is that SBinit.txt is not being updated correctly.

Changed the arrayOfTasks and skbUserProfile in SkillBlazer.java to static class fields which are actually instantiated by method calls in main(). Added method call to JSONWriter.saveAllFilesToDisk(profile, arrayList); to method closeProgram() in SkillBlazer.java. Program now writes files to disk prior to terminating.

1. added jsonObject.put() lines for notes, goalToReach, and goalUnits to CumulativeTask.java 2. removed jsonObject.put() calls for currentStreak and bestStreak from writeTaskToJSON(), added field 'notes' to writeTaskToJSON() in CustomTask.java (Removed old constructor) 3. Removed currentStreak and bestStreak from writeTaskToJSON(), Removed old constructor, from Class DailyTask.java 4. Removed all references to currentStreak & bestStreak from parseCreateAndAddTaskToList(), added 'notes' to parseCreateAndAddTaskToList() in JSONLoader.java Removed currentStreak & bestSTreak from constructor calls for all Task objects, added jsonObject.get(goalToReach) and jsonObject.get(goalUnits) to switch case for the CumulativeTask parse methods in parseCreateAndAddTaskToList() in JSONLoader.java 5. Removed unused Iterator<Task> from SkillBlazer.java 6. Removed currentStreak & bestStreak and old fully-qualified constructor, added jsonObject.put("notes") call to writeTaskToJSON() method in WeeklyTask.java

Removed commented-out constructor from CustomTask.java Changed JSONLoader to now pull the username from the OS filesystem folder names, unless a non-default value is already set. Removed saveHistoryToFile() from class JSONWriter.java removed zombie Aquafx code from SkillBlazer.java removed ArrayList<Task> arrayOfTasks (jason's arraylist) from SkillBlazer.java -> set ArrayList<Task> taskList to STATIC so that Jason and Rebecca's code are using the same arraylist. This still needs improvement added <> to ArrayList<Calendar> datesCompleted = new ArrayList<>(); in Task.java

Changed createTaskObject() in SkillBlazer.java to use a method in UserProfile.java which will increment the taskNumber (class field) and return the incremented value. This will automate the creation of new task numbers through the GUI.

Added a constructor to CumulativeTask.java -> this constructor includes the ArrayList<CumulativeHistoryStruct> as the last parameter CustomTask.java writeToJSON() method now has an additional constructor which accepts a datesCompleted ArrayList<Calendar> as the last parameter, and a call to the JSONWriter.java prepareCalendarObjectsForJSONStorage(jsonObject, datesCompleted) method. This feature requires testing DailyTask.java writeToJSON() method now has an additional constructor which accepts a datesCompleted ArrayList<Calendar> as the last parameter, and a call to the JSONWriter.java prepareCalendarObjectsForJSONStorage(jsonObject, datesCompleted) method. This feature requires testing WeeklyTask.java writeToJSON() method now has an additional constructor which accepts a datesCompleted ArrayList<Calendar> as the last parameter, and a call to the JSONWriter.java prepareCalendarObjectsForJSONStorage(jsonObject, datesCompleted) method. This feature requires testing Task.java now has an additional constructor which accepts a datesCompleted ArrayList<Calendar> as the last parameter. This feature requires testing JSONLoader.java now has calls to the switch: "daily", "weekly", and "custom" cases, which call a method to parse Calendar objects (for completion dates) from the JSON file JSONLoader.java now has a method parseCompletionDates(jsonObject, jsonDatesCompleted, completionCount) which will pull all of the JSONArrays which represent completion dates (Calendar objects) out of the JSON file. REQUIRES TESTING JSONWriter.java now has a method prepareCalendarObjectsForJSONStorage(jsonCalendarObject, datesCompleted) which takes all of the Calendar objects which represent completionDates in a TASK, and converts them to JSON arrays that are added to the JSONObject. REQUIRES TESTING Removed old comments from various files as I found them.

Changed completionCount in JSONLoader and JSONWriter (all references) so that it is always in range 1,2,..N (no zeroes) in JSONLoader parseCreateAndAddTaskToList() the switch cases for "weekly","daily","custom" now check the completionCount, if its greater than zero it calls the method to parse out the completionDates (Calendar) objects, and calls the appropriate *Task constructor with the ArrayList<Calendar> completionDates parameter. JSONLoader -> if completionCount is zero the [sub]Task will be instantiated without a completionDates parameter.

Promoted CumulativeHistoryStruct from being an inner class of CumulativeTask to a separate, public class. Completed the initial code for parsing and writing CumulativeHistoryStruct objects in and out of JSON files. The initial version of everything required to store History is now included in the program, and requires testing. (No push yet).

Fixed stupid loop decisions which were writing the same completion info pretty much everywhere. JSONLoader.java -> Fixed parseHistoryStruct() and parseCreateAndAddTaskToList() JSONWriter.java -> Fixed prepareCalendarObjectsForJSONStorage() and prepareCumulativeHistoryStructForJSONStorage() Completion dates and the CumulativeHistoryStruct objects now write to JSON, and are parsed back from JSON correctly.

MESSAGE.value: Removed primitive (int) and (long) casts throughout JSONLoader.java -> ArrayList<Task> now returning arrays to test main() method! UserProfile object now being instantiated correctly!

Finished testing the CumulativeTask.java, CustomTask.java, DailyTask.java, WeeklyTask.java and UserProfile.java classes (instantiating them from json objects stored to disk). Removed test code, and left the necessary object instantiations in SkillBlazer.java and SkillBlazer.main()

fixed casts to values that should be (long) in JSONWriter.java removed unneeded class fields - corrected return statement in Task.getTaskId() so it returns a useful value - removed commented out code from SkillBlazer.java - removed unused fields in JSONLoader.java
one last obsolete comment removal in loadFromJSON() in JSONLoader.java

Laid out basic components of JSONWriter.java -> added methods addFileToInit, writeUserProfileToDisk(), writeCumulativeTaskToDisk(), writeCustomTaskToDisk(), writeDailyTaskToDisk(), writeWeeklyTaskToDisk() and saveUser() so that saving Tasks and the UserProfile can be performed as single operations. These methods will be called by convertArrayListToJSONArray() once completed. In JSONLoader.java I made skillBlazerInit and userProfile package-protected members (no longer private) to ease use in other classes. Also made skillBlazerInit STATIC for the same reason.
Initial version of writeUserProfileToDisk() created
Initial version of JSONWriter.java is completed and ready for testing/verification.

created method saveAllFilesToDisk() in JSONWriter.java -> compiles, but the casts need to be replaced with Generics or the writeTaskToJSON() methods should be moved to their appropriate Task subclasses!
Moved the individual sub-Task writeTaskToJSON() methods to their respective classes as @Override methods of Task.writeTaskToJSON() SHUTDOWN ROUTINE NOW COMPILES WITHOUT DISGUSTING NASTY CASTS!
removed unneeded imports from JSONWriter.java
added JSONWriter instantiation in SkillBlazer.java (class member field) and updated comments in JSONWriter.java
added method convertInt(Long value) to JSONLoader.java to significantly reduce assignment statements in the parsing methods

Various changes to improve ability to save Tasks to disk. Added toString() and getType() methods to UserProfile.java. Created method convertInt() to JSONLoader.java. Removed tons of unnecessary values for parsing numerics from JSON files in the parseCreateAndAddTaskToList and parseAndReturnUserProfile methods in JSONLoader.java. Added method getFileContents() to JSONWriter to make an arraylist of existing file contents that is passed back to addFileToInit() in JSONWriter, which intelligently addes filenames to SBinit.txt. (Refactored JSONWriter to correct the behavior of adding files to this list). Removed TODOs in a couple places, made updates to commenting throughout the JSONWriter, JSONLoader and SkillBlazerInitializer files. Added functionality to getFileList() in SkillBlazerInitializer so that it makes sure that files listed in SBinit.txt are still present in the SkillBlazer folder on disk.

fixed maddening bug in SkillBlazerInitializer.java method getFileList() that was not returning file names from SBinit.txt correctly, thus causing items to never get parsed. Now the bug is that SBinit.txt is not being updated correctly.

Changed the arrayOfTasks and skbUserProfile in SkillBlazer.java to static class fields which are actually instantiated by method calls in main(). Added method call to JSONWriter.saveAllFilesToDisk(profile, arrayList); to method closeProgram() in SkillBlazer.java. Program now writes files to disk prior to terminating.

1. added jsonObject.put() lines for notes, goalToReach, and goalUnits to CumulativeTask.java 2. removed jsonObject.put() calls for currentStreak and bestStreak from writeTaskToJSON(), added field 'notes' to writeTaskToJSON() in CustomTask.java (Removed old constructor) 3. Removed currentStreak and bestStreak from writeTaskToJSON(), Removed old constructor, from Class DailyTask.java 4. Removed all references to currentStreak & bestStreak from parseCreateAndAddTaskToList(), added 'notes' to parseCreateAndAddTaskToList() in JSONLoader.java Removed currentStreak & bestSTreak from constructor calls for all Task objects, added jsonObject.get(goalToReach) and jsonObject.get(goalUnits) to switch case for the CumulativeTask parse methods in parseCreateAndAddTaskToList() in JSONLoader.java 5. Removed unused Iterator<Task> from SkillBlazer.java 6. Removed currentStreak & bestStreak and old fully-qualified constructor, added jsonObject.put("notes") call to writeTaskToJSON() method in WeeklyTask.java
Removed commented-out constructor from CustomTask.java

Removed commented-out constructor from CustomTask.java Changed JSONLoader to now pull the username from the OS filesystem folder names, unless a non-default value is already set. Removed saveHistoryToFile() from class JSONWriter.java removed zombie Aquafx code from SkillBlazer.java removed ArrayList<Task> arrayOfTasks (jason's arraylist) from SkillBlazer.java -> set ArrayList<Task> taskList to STATIC so that Jason and Rebecca's code are using the same arraylist. This still needs improvement added <> to ArrayList<Calendar> datesCompleted = new ArrayList<>(); in Task.java

Changed createTaskObject() in SkillBlazer.java to use a method in UserProfile.java which will increment the taskNumber (class field) and return the incremented value. This will automate the creation of new task numbers through the GUI.

Added a constructor to CumulativeTask.java -> this constructor includes the ArrayList<CumulativeHistoryStruct> as the last parameter CustomTask.java writeToJSON() method now has an additional constructor which accepts a datesCompleted ArrayList<Calendar> as the last parameter, and a call to the JSONWriter.java prepareCalendarObjectsForJSONStorage(jsonObject, datesCompleted) method. This feature requires testing DailyTask.java writeToJSON() method now has an additional constructor which accepts a datesCompleted ArrayList<Calendar> as the last parameter, and a call to the JSONWriter.java prepareCalendarObjectsForJSONStorage(jsonObject, datesCompleted) method. This feature requires testing WeeklyTask.java writeToJSON() method now has an additional constructor which accepts a datesCompleted ArrayList<Calendar> as the last parameter, and a call to the JSONWriter.java prepareCalendarObjectsForJSONStorage(jsonObject, datesCompleted) method. This feature requires testing Task.java now has an additional constructor which accepts a datesCompleted ArrayList<Calendar> as the last parameter. This feature requires testing JSONLoader.java now has calls to the switch: "daily", "weekly", and "custom" cases, which call a method to parse Calendar objects (for completion dates) from the JSON file JSONLoader.java now has a method parseCompletionDates(jsonObject, jsonDatesCompleted, completionCount) which will pull all of the JSONArrays which represent completion dates (Calendar objects) out of the JSON file. REQUIRES TESTING JSONWriter.java now has a method prepareCalendarObjectsForJSONStorage(jsonCalendarObject, datesCompleted) which takes all of the Calendar objects which represent completionDates in a TASK, and converts them to JSON arrays that are added to the JSONObject. REQUIRES TESTING Removed old comments from various files as I found them.

Changed completionCount in JSONLoader and JSONWriter (all references) so that it is always in range 1,2,..N (no zeroes) in JSONLoader parseCreateAndAddTaskToList() the switch cases for "weekly","daily","custom" now check the completionCount, if its greater than zero it calls the method to parse out the completionDates (Calendar) objects, and calls the appropriate *Task constructor with the ArrayList<Calendar> completionDates parameter. JSONLoader -> if completionCount is zero the [sub]Task will be instantiated without a completionDates parameter.

Promoted CumulativeHistoryStruct from being an inner class of CumulativeTask to a separate, public class. Completed the initial code for parsing and writing CumulativeHistoryStruct objects in and out of JSON files. The initial version of everything required to store History is now included in the program, and requires testing. (No push yet).

Fixed stupid loop decisions which were writing the same completion info pretty much everywhere. JSONLoader.java -> Fixed parseHistoryStruct() and parseCreateAndAddTaskToList() JSONWriter.java -> Fixed prepareCalendarObjectsForJSONStorage() and prepareCumulativeHistoryStructForJSONStorage() Completion dates and the CumulativeHistoryStruct objects now write to JSON, and are parsed back from JSON correctly.
